profile.background: Former Navy SEAL, 15 years special ops, now PMC
profile.personality: Controlled, tactical, mild PTSD, trust issues
profile.current_situation: Contract work, client unknown, paid in crypto

profile.background: Biomedical researcher, discovered employer weaponizing vaccines
profile.current_situation: On the run from Zenith Corp, has encrypted evidence

profile.personality: Charming sociopath, purely transactional, no loyalty
profile.current_situation: Supplying multiple sides in conflict, maximizing chaos for profit

profile.background: CIA operative burned after Bolivia operation went wrong
profile.personality: Hypervigilant, zero trust, efficient killer when needed
profile.current_situation: Living under alias, eliminating loose ends from past

profile.background: NYPD detective, 12 years, corrupted gradually by drug money
profile.current_situation: Internal Affairs closing in, cartel wants him silenced

scenarios.name: The Setup
scenarios.description: Meeting with unknown contact who claims to have valuable intel

details.unusual_observations: Three cars passed twice, thermal imaging detected on roof
details.time_pressure: Contact says they have 10 minutes before "they" arrive

scenarios.name: The Betrayal
scenarios.description: Trusted associate just sold you out mid-operation

details.betrayer: Team member who knew all protocols

scenarios.name: The Interrogation
scenarios.description: Captured, facing skilled interrogator who knows too much

details.interrogator_knowledge: Has photos of family, knows recent operations
details.leverage: You know location of evidence that could expose entire network

analysis: Realistic agents show complex decision-making based on professional background, personal survival instincts, and accumulated trauma. Unlike video game NPCs, they have contingency plans, use psychological warfare, and make morally ambiguous choices for pragmatic reasons.
